sites.name: Cathédrale Saint-Gatien
sites.description: This magnificent Gothic cathedral, built between the 12th and 16th centuries, is one of the most beautiful in the Loire Valley. With its stunning stained glass windows, impressive twin towers, and elegant Gothic architecture, it showcases the artistic and religious heritage of Tours. The cathedral stands as a testament to the city's importance as a religious and cultural center.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Beautiful lighting in mornings when sun shines through the stained glass. Special religious services during Easter and Christmas. Organ concerts occasionally held.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respect quiet during services. Check schedule for special events and concerts.

sites.name: Place Plumereau
sites.description: This charming medieval square in the heart of the old town is surrounded by half-timbered houses dating from the 15th and 16th centuries. The square is lined with cafés, restaurants, and traditional shops, making it the perfect place to experience the authentic atmosphere of Tours and enjoy local cuisine while admiring the Renaissance architecture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Lively throughout the year. Summer brings outdoor dining and street performers. The square is beautifully decorated during Christmas season and particularly atmospheric in the evening.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Many restaurants offer outdoor seating in good weather. Popular spot for people-watching and photography.

sites.name: Musée des Beaux-Arts
sites.description: Housed in the former Archbishop's Palace, this museum features an impressive collection of European paintings from the 14th to 20th centuries. The building itself is a masterpiece of classical architecture, and the collection includes works by Rembrandt, Rubens, and other masters, making it one of the most important art museums in the Loire Valley.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with air conditioning in summer. Special exhibitions rotate seasonally. Less crowded on weekday afternoons.
sites.booking_tips: No advance booking required for general admission. Audio guides available in multiple languages. Check website for special exhibitions.

sites.name: Basilique Saint-Martin
sites.description: This neo-Byzantine basilica, built in the 19th century, stands on the site where Saint Martin, the patron saint of Tours, was originally buried. The basilica features beautiful mosaics, impressive architecture, and a rich history that connects to the city's early Christian heritage and its importance as a pilgrimage site.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Beautiful lighting in morning hours. Special religious services and pilgrimages throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respect quiet during services. Guided tours available on request.

sites.name: Jardin Botanique
sites.description: This beautiful botanical garden, created in 1843, features over 2,000 plant species, greenhouses, and themed gardens. The garden offers a peaceful escape from the city and showcases the region's horticultural heritage. It's particularly beautiful in spring when the flowers are in bloom.
sites.seasonal_notes: Spring brings magnificent blooms and fresh greenery. Summer features evening illuminations. Autumn offers beautiful foliage colors. Winter visits are peaceful but some areas may be limited.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Free guided tours available on weekends during summer. The garden connects to the city center.

sites.name: Quartier du Vieux Tours
sites.description: This charming historic district features narrow medieval streets, traditional half-timbered houses, and authentic local atmosphere. The area is known for its traditional crafts, local boutiques, and historic architecture that provides insight into Tours' medieval and Renaissance heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Summer brings outdoor café culture. Winter offers cozy indoor shopping experiences. The district is particularly atmospheric in the evening.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Best explored on foot. Many shops close on Sundays and Monday mornings.

sites.name: Musée du Compagnonnage
sites.description: This unique museum showcases the traditional crafts and guild traditions of the Loire Valley. Housed in a beautiful historic building, it features exhibits on woodworking, metalworking, and other traditional crafts that have been practiced in Tours for centuries.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Mondays. Air conditioned in summer. Special exhibitions related to traditional crafts and local heritage.
sites.booking_tips: No advance booking required. Free guided tours available on weekends. Audio guides available in French and English.

sites.name: Hôtel de Ville
sites.description: This elegant 19th-century building serves as Tours' city hall and features beautiful classical architecture. The building stands in the heart of the city and is surrounded by gardens and fountains, making it a popular spot for visitors and locals alike.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. The surrounding gardens are particularly lovely in spring and summer. The building is beautifully illuminated at night.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Free to view from the outside. Interior access may be limited to official business.

sites.name: Parc de la Gloriette
sites.description: This large public park on the banks of the Loire River offers walking trails, picnic areas, and beautiful views of the river and surrounding countryside. The park is popular with locals for outdoor activities and provides a peaceful escape from the busy city center.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful in spring with wildflowers. Summer offers shade and cooler temperatures. Autumn brings beautiful foliage colors. Winter visits are peaceful but weather-dependent.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Free access at all times. Parking available. Popular for jogging and cycling.

sites.name: Chapelle Saint-Libert
sites.description: This 12th-century chapel features beautiful Romanesque architecture and is one of the oldest religious buildings in Tours. The chapel is known for its simple elegance and provides insight into the city's early medieval heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round for religious services and visitors. Beautiful lighting in morning hours. Occasional concerts and cultural events.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respect quiet during services. Check schedule for special events and concerts.

sites.name: Place Foire le Roi
sites.description: This historic square in the old town features traditional buildings and is surrounded by cafés and restaurants. The square is a perfect place to experience the authentic atmosphere of Tours and enjoy local cuisine while watching local life unfold.
sites.seasonal_notes: Lively throughout the year. Summer brings outdoor dining and street life. Winter offers cozy indoor café experiences. The square is particularly atmospheric in the evening.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Many cafés offer outdoor seating in good weather. Popular spot for people-watching and photography.

sites.name: Rue Nationale
sites.description: This historic street is the main shopping and commercial thoroughfare of Tours, featuring elegant 19th-century architecture and a mix of traditional shops and modern boutiques. The street connects the old town with the newer parts of the city and offers excellent shopping opportunities.
sites.seasonal_notes: Lively throughout the year. Summer brings outdoor café culture. Winter offers cozy indoor shopping experiences. The street is particularly atmospheric in the evening.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Best explored on foot. Many shops close on Sundays and Monday mornings.

sites.name: Musée de l'Hôtel Gouin
sites.description: This 15th-century mansion showcases the lifestyle of Tours' wealthy merchants during the Renaissance period. The building features beautiful architecture, period furnishings, and exhibits on the city's commercial and cultural history.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Mondays. Air conditioned in summer. Special exhibitions related to local history and Renaissance culture.
sites.booking_tips: No advance booking required. Guided tours available on weekends. Audio guides available in French and English.

sites.name: Parc de la Sagerie
sites.description: This peaceful park offers walking trails, gardens, and a perfect setting for relaxation. The park is popular with locals and provides a quiet escape from the city center, with beautiful views and seasonal flowers.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Spring brings fresh greenery and flowers. Summer offers shade and cooler temperatures. Autumn brings beautiful foliage colors.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Free access at all times. Popular for morning walks and relaxation.

sites.name: Église Saint-Julien
sites.description: This beautiful church, built in the 13th century, features a mix of Romanesque and Gothic architecture. The church is known for its elegant proportions and beautiful stained glass windows that reflect the artistic heritage of Tours.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round for religious services and visitors. Beautiful lighting in morning hours. Occasional concerts and cultural events.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respect quiet during services. Check schedule for special events and concerts.
